text:
split sequence() function in the previous section outputs the X with the shape [samples,
features] ready to use for modeling. The model is ﬁt using the eﬃcient Adam version of
stochastic gradient descent and optimized using the mean squared error, or ‘mse’, loss function.
Once the model is deﬁned, we can ﬁt it on the training dataset.
# fit model
model.fit(X, y, epochs=2000, verbose=0)
Listing 7.7: Example of ﬁtting an MLP model.
